1.text: Whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.

2.text: Mix the eggs, buttermilk, melted butter, and extract in another bowl.

3.text: Whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until they're combined.

4.text: Grease a skillet or griddle with oil and turn the heat to medium.

5.text: Spoon 1/3 cup (120 g) of batter into the pan for each pancake.

6.text: Cook the pancakes for 3 minutes so they begin to bubble.

7.text: Flip the pancakes and cook them for 2 more minutes.

8.text: Serve the pancakes with butter and maple syrup.

9.text: Add berries to the pancakes before you flip them if you want a fruity treat.

10.text: Put cocoa powder in the batter or add chocolate chips for decadent pancakes.

11.text: Stir 1/2 cup (50 g) of chopped mixed nuts into the batter for extra crunch.

12.text: Mix 2 teaspoons (4 g) of spices into the pancakes to customize the flavor.

13.text: Garnish the pancakes with chocolate sauce and whipped cream to make dessert.

14.text: Serve the buttermilk pancakes with fried eggs and sausage for a savory meal.
